tool.name: Small RNA Phasing

param.name: genomeSource
param.label: Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in index?
param.help: Built-ins were indexed using default options

param.name: index
param.label: Select the reference genome used for the bowtie output
param.help: if your genome of interest is not listed - contact Christophe Antoniewski at drosofff@gmail.com

param.name: input
param.label: Compute phasing from this bowtie standard output

param.name: minquery
param.label: Min size of query small RNAs

param.name: maxquery
param.label: Max size of query small RNAs

param.name: minscope
param.label: Min offset for the phasing search

param.name: maxscope
param.label: Max offset for the phasing search

configfiles.configfile:
## Setup R error handling to go to stderr options( show.error.messages=F, error = function () { cat( geterrmessage(), file=stderr() ); q( "no", 1, F ) } ) phasing = read.delim("${output}", header=TRUE)
## Open outputpdf PDF file pdf( "${outputpdf}" ) plot(phasing[,1], phasing[,2]*100, type = "b", main="Phasing probability of ${minquery}-${maxquery}nt small RNAs", cex.main=1, xlab="relative offset (nt)", ylab="Phasing Probability [%]", pch=19, cex=0.8, col="darkslateblue", lwd =4, cex.lab=1.2, cex.axis=1, xaxt="n") axis(1, at=seq(from=head(phasing[,1], n=1), to=tail(phasing[,1], n=1), by=3) ) devname = dev.off()

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool computes the phasing probability from a bowtie output file following an algorithm inspired from Brennecke et al (2009) Science.
